definition[0]: an unhealthy condition of plants in which parts of them dry up and die
definition[1]: something that makes people unhappy or that spoils their lives or the environment they live in
example[1]: Her guilty secret was a blight on her happiness.
definition[2]: to spoil or damage something, especially by preventing people from doing what they want to do
example[2]: a disease which, though not fatal, can blight the lives of its victims
